summary: RESET 100% confirmé : nouvelle V1.0 officielle basée sur 2 fichiers uniquement. Backend Motoko minimal (stable var salons, auto-seed de 4 salons suisses, getSalons + createSalon) et frontend React minimal (src/App.jsx) avec navigation landing/auth/app, sélection Client/Pro locale, liste salons avec filtres FR, et Studio Pro gamifié; aucune conservation des features avancées précédentes (II, persistance complète, créneaux, réservations, upload on-chain, React Query, etc.).
architectural_notes: RESET complet : écrasement total du backend et du frontend, considéré comme nouvelle V1.0 officielle.
Backend Motoko réduit à un modèle Salon/Service/Socials avec `stable var salons` et endpoints `getSalons` (query) + `createSalon` (shared); seed de 4 salons suisses au démarrage (si salons vide).

Frontend réduit à un seul `src/App.jsx` autonome (sans React Query/II) : données salons initialisées côté client (miroir du seed) + choix de rôle Client/Pro via écran Auth + Studio Pro gamifié pour ajouter un salon localement.
known_issues: Risque de confusion dans le périmètre « temps réel » : l’actualisation du graphique doit se faire après actions utilisateur (pas de push serveur).

Incohérence de spécification à résoudre : une feature existante demande de garder les textes UI en anglais (REQ-11) alors que la direction produit impose désormais une traduction intégrale 100% français.
L’application côté Client est cassée : présence de textes/données en anglais (ex: catégories Hairdresser/Haircut, Paris) au lieu de 100% FR + contexte Suisse (Lausanne/Genève/Montreux, CHF).
Régression UI/UX : la barre de filtres en haut a disparu et/ou la logique de filtrage par catégorie ne fonctionne plus (ex: clic 'Barbier' n’isole pas les salons 'Barbier').

Le RESET supprime explicitement des fonctionnalités précédemment prévues/implémentées (Internet Identity, rôles backend, persistance complète pré/post-upgrade, créneaux datés, réservations, Monopoly Mode, upload d’images on-chain, React Query).

Le code backend fourni utilise `public func init()` pour l’initialisation; sur IC, l’initialisation standard se fait via le hook système `system func init()` (risque que le seed ne s’exécute pas automatiquement).
Les champs `image` contiennent des liens au format Markdown `[url](url)` au lieu d’une URL brute, ce qui peut casser l’affichage `` côté React.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity authentication and replace the existing fake login screen with the Internet Identity login flow.
Implement role-based routing after Internet Identity login: redirect the authenticated user to the correct dashboard (Client or Pro) based on the user role stored/returned by the backend.
Replace static frontend lists (e.g., SALONS, MEMBRES_EQUIPE) with dynamic data loaded from the Motoko backend using React Query.
Add backend persistence and minimal CRUD for salons: allow creating a new salon from the existing UI and persist it in the Motoko canister so it remains after refresh.

Make the booking confirmation button functional: when the user confirms a booking, the frontend calls the backend to create a booking, and the backend removes/deducts the selected slot from the salon’s availability so it cannot be booked again.

Implement Optimistic UI for the Monopoly Mode switch: when the user toggles the switch, update the switch UI state and the revenue chart immediately, then reconcile with the backend response (rollback and show an error if the backend call fails).

Update the revenue chart only after user actions (e.g., booking confirmation, Monopoly Mode toggle) by refetching/recomputing relevant data from the backend; do not implement server push or real-time sockets.
Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme across the frontend while preserving the provided layout and UX structure; keep all user-facing text in English.

Replace the current Pro ‘Create salon’ single-input form with a 3-step configuration wizard: Step 1 Salon info (Name, Neighborhood, Description, optional Photo URL), Step 2 Services (add/remove services with Label, Duration (minutes), Price), Step 3 Planning (define opening hours used to generate availability). On completion, submit the full configuration to the backend and create the salon with generated availability for today and tomorrow.

Update the client home salon list UI to be driven by backend salon metadata: display each salon’s real photo (from salon.photoUrl), description, neighborhood, and premium status. Ensure the UI does not show an ‘No salons available’ empty state under normal conditions because the backend auto-seeds salons when empty.

Implement a loyalty system: add XP to the client profile, show a ‘Member Card’ on the client Profile tab with a VIP progress bar and tier label (e.g., “Silver — 300 XP”), and grant XP whenever a booking is successfully confirmed. Store XP in the backend user profile so it persists across refresh/login.

Add a visual ‘Premium’ badge on salons marked as premium by the backend (in both the salon list and salon details surfaces). The badge must be data-driven (based on the backend isPremium field), not hardcoded to the first salon.

Fully localize the entire frontend UI to French (zero remaining English), replacing all user-facing strings across pages, components, tabs, buttons, labels, placeholders, empty states, loading states, and error messages with elegant French wording.

Add native-like page/screen transitions using Framer Motion by wrapping the app’s screen-level rendering with <AnimatePresence mode="wait"> and applying a consistent slide-in/slide-out animation between screen changes (e.g., Login ↔ Profile setup ↔ Client dashboard ↔ Pro dashboard, and within dashboards when switching between major views like Salon list ↔ Salon details).

Add tactile press feedback to all clickable buttons and clickable cards by applying whileTap={{ scale: 0.96 }} (or equivalent Framer Motion press interaction) consistently across the app, including Shadcn <Button>, native <button>, and div-based clickable cards used for salon selection and service selection.

Replace the Client Profile tab’s current simple profile content with a “VIP Dashboard” layout that includes: (1) an animated circular progress indicator showing the user’s current status and percent completion (e.g., “Statut Gold — 75%”), and (2) a “Next reward” section that displays “Récompense prochaine : -20% dans 2 résas”. Keep it data-driven where possible using the existing user profile (tier/xp) already loaded in the Client dashboard.

Improve empty states so the app never shows an empty screen with only text: (1) when the bookings/agenda view is empty, show a clear call-to-action button labeled “Trouver une dispo ce soir” that navigates back to the Home/Explore tab; (2) when no salons are returned, show the French message “On ouvre bientôt près de chez vous...” and ensure the layout still includes a visually rich empty-state block (icon/illustration-style container + CTA where appropriate).

Add on-chain salon image upload and retrieval: extend the backend to store salon images as persistent Blob data (stable) and expose actor methods to (a) upload an image for a salon, (b) associate uploaded image(s) with the salon, and (c) retrieve image bytes (and content type) by an image identifier so the frontend can render the real uploaded image.

Maintain Swiss market context in data and pricing displays: update seeded salons and any default location strings in the backend to use French-speaking Swiss cities/neighborhoods, and update frontend price rendering to display CHF (not €) wherever service price, surge, or totals are shown.

Make the category filtering UI (e.g., Hairdresser/Barber/etc.) load its category values from backend-driven data rather than hardcoded frontend constants. Provide a backend query that returns the available categories (either explicit salon categories or derived from services) and update the frontend to use it via React Query.

Restore the Client category filter bar at the top of the salon list and make filtering work exactly with the French categories: show buttons in this order ["Tout", "Coiffure", "Barbier", "Spa", "Onglerie"], and when a category is selected (e.g., "Barbier"), display only salons that match that category (based on salon services category data).

Remove remaining Paris/English UI regressions on the Client surfaces explicitly called out by the user: replace the AuthHeader badge text "PARIS 11e" with "Suisse Romande" (Client user type), replace the salon list section title "Recommended for you" with "Les meilleures adresses", and ensure the welcome header text reads "Bienvenue".

Eliminate obvious remaining English strings on the Client salon list and salon details flows that contribute to the app feeling partially broken, including error/empty-state labels and primary action buttons, so the Client experience is consistently French.

Implement the gamified ProStudioCreator component (the gauge-based dark 'Midnight' UI) as the official Pro salon creation interface, and replace the current ProSalonWizard usage in the Pro dashboard with ProStudioCreator.

Wire ProStudioCreator to the backend: on publish, call createSalon with the entered salon metadata/services and then (if a local image file is chosen) upload the image bytes to the backend using ArrayBuffer->Uint8Array and uploadSalonImage; ensure React Query caches are invalidated so the new salon appears in the client list without a hard refresh.
Update the SalonDetails page to display social icons/links under the description when salon.socials exists (Instagram/Facebook/Website), while keeping the existing Midnight styling.
Keep the corrected category filter UX exactly as: ["Tout", "Coiffure", "Barbier", "Spa", "Onglerie"], and ensure filtering continues to work by salon service category.

Perform a complete frontend reset by removing the existing frontend application code and replacing the app’s root component with the user-provided `src/App.jsx` code as the official V1.0 UI, while respecting platform constraints on immutable files by wiring the new app through editable entry points only.

Treat the reset as a hard cutover: remove/disable all previously implemented advanced features and code paths (e.g., Internet Identity auth, role-based routing, React Query data layer, bookings/availability/monopoly mode logic, on-chain image upload, loyalty/VIP dashboard, seeded premium salons logic) unless they exist in the two user-provided V1.0 files.

new_feature_requests.summary: Transformer le frontend React fourni en DApp full‑stack sur l’Internet Computer (Caffeine) avec backend Motoko
Authentification Internet Identity (remplacer l’écran login factice) + redirection post-login selon rôle (Client vs Pro)
Backend Motoko single-canister avec persistance : gestion Salons, Services, Utilisateurs/Rôles, Réservations
Données dynamiques : CRUD salons (au minimum créer un salon sauvegardé), remplacement des listes statiques (SALONS, MEMBRES_EQUIPE)
Gestion explicite des créneaux par salon générés par le backend (ex: 14h–23h) avec catégorisation Nuit (>19h) et Dimanche
Réservations : rendre le bouton « Confirmer » fonctionnel (enregistrer réservation, déduire/retirer le créneau des disponibilités)
Logique business « Mode Monopole » côté backend : visibilité + majoration automatique de 20% sur réservations Nuit/Dimanche; mise à jour du graphique revenus après actions utilisateur
UX : Optimistic UI pour le switch « Mode Monopole » (changement UI/graphique immédiat puis confirmation backend)
Implement backend-generated explicit availability time slots per salon, including a slot classification that identifies whether a slot is 'Night' (time > 19:00) and whether it is Sunday.
Generate default availability slots for each salon in the backend (e.g., every hour from 14:00 to 23:00) and ensure they exist for newly created salons.
Implement the 'Monopoly Mode' switch business logic in the backend: when enabled, apply an automatic +20% markup to the total booking price for bookings on Night slots (time > 19:00) or on Sunday.

Auto-seeding au démarrage : générer automatiquement 5 salons premium/luxe avec vraies photos, descriptions, services et créneaux réservables pour aujourd’hui et demain afin d’éviter l’état « Aucun salon disponible »

Création de salon avancée (mode SaaS) : remplacer le champ simple par un wizard de configuration en 3 étapes (Infos salon: nom/quartier/description; Services: ajout libellé/durée/prix; Planning: définition des heures d’ouverture)
Système de fidélité : carte de membre dans le profil client, barre de progression VIP (XP/niveau), ajout de points à chaque réservation confirmée, badge visuel « Premium » sur les salons

Implement backend auto-seeding so the app always starts with at least 5 premium/luxury salons (never an empty salon list). On canister init and post-upgrade (or on the first getSalons call), if there are zero salons stored, automatically create 5 salons with: (1) premium flag, (2) photo URL(s) pointing to real photos, (3) neighborhood and description, (4) a non-empty services list, and (5) bookable availability time slots for today and tomorrow.

Extend the backend salon and booking data model to support the new SaaS creation flow and seeded content: salons must store neighborhood, description, photo URL, premium flag, and a list of services (label, durationMinutes, price). Availability must support bookable slots for specific dates (today/tomorrow), not only a weekday label. Update booking logic to book a specific date+time slot and to correctly mark that exact slot as unavailable after booking.

Traduction intégrale du frontend (zéro anglais) : scanner tout le code UI et remplacer tous les libellés/termes anglais restants par un français élégant (ex: Create New Salon→Ouvrir un Établissement, Neighborhood→Quartier, Bookings→Mon Agenda).

Fluidité & animations type "app native" : ajouter <AnimatePresence mode='wait'> autour du routeur pour transitions Slide In/Out entre pages + whileTap { scale: 0.96 } sur tous les boutons et cartes cliquables.
Gamification Profil : remplacer la liste du profil par un "Dashboard VIP" avec cercle de progression animé (ex: "Statut Gold - 75%") + section "Récompense prochaine : -20% dans 2 résas".

Gestion des états vides par CTA : ne jamais laisser un écran vide; si agenda vide afficher bouton "Trouver une dispo ce soir" (redirige accueil); si aucun salon trouvé afficher "On ouvre bientôt près de chez vous...".

Support upload et stockage on-chain des images de salons : côté frontend, uploader une image réelle dans le flow Pro « Créer un salon » et l’envoyer au backend; côté backend Motoko, stocker l’image (Blob) de manière persistante (Stable Memory) et la servir ensuite au frontend.

Implement true stable-memory persistence for all core backend data so it survives refresh/upgrade: user profiles (keyed by Principal and including role), salons (including metadata and availability), and bookings (linked to user and salon). Use the Internet Computer upgrade hooks (preupgrade/postupgrade) to serialize/restore state, and add a conditional backend migration (backend/migration.mo) only if required to preserve existing deployed state.

Align booking pricing logic with the Swiss Monopoly Mode business rule strictly on the backend: when Monopoly Mode is enabled for the salon’s Pro, apply an automatic +20% markup to the final booking price for Night slots (time > 19:00) and/or Sunday slots, based on the booked slot’s stored classification (isNight/isSunday). Remove any incorrect hardcoding (e.g., always-false Sunday) and ensure the chosen slot’s flags drive pricing.

Update the backend salon seeding data so it is 100% French + Swiss and does not introduce English categories/services into the Client app: seed salons only in Lausanne, Genève, and Montreux; ensure seeded services use only the categories "Coiffure", "Barbier", "Spa", "Onglerie" (no "Hairdresser", no "Physiotherapist", no English service names).

Backend Motoko : remplacer/adapter l’auto-seeding pour initialiser en mémoire stable exactement les 4 salons suisses fournis (BlackBlade, Le Studio – L'Oréal, Suzy Coiffure & Head Spa, EMER Coiffure) au démarrage (on-chain)
Frontend Pro : remplacer ProCreateSalon par ProStudioCreator (version gamifiée avec jauge) et le connecter au backend (createSalon) ; gérer l’upload d’image via Blob/ArrayBuffer vers Motoko

Frontend UX : imposer les catégories de filtre ["Tout","Coiffure","Barbier","Spa","Onglerie"], conserver le thème sombre « Midnight », et afficher les réseaux sociaux (Instagram/Facebook/Site Web) dans SalonDetail si disponibles

Replace the backend salon auto-seeding logic so that, when the canister has zero salons, it seeds exactly the 4 Swiss salons provided by the user (BlackBlade Hairstylist, Le Studio - L'Oréal, Suzy Coiffure & Head Spa, EMER Coiffure) into persistent storage (survives refresh and upgrade).

Implement true stable persistence for salons, bookings, images, and user profiles using Internet Computer upgrade hooks (preupgrade/postupgrade) so seeded data and user-created data survive upgrades; apply seeding on init/post-upgrade only when there are zero salons stored.

Extend the backend Salon data model to support social links (instagram/facebook/website) coming from the Swiss seed dataset and needed by the SalonDetails UI, and expose them via existing getSalons/getSalon responses.

Add/adjust backend createSalon support so the Pro creation flow can create a salon and then upload an on-chain image (Blob) from the frontend using ArrayBuffer/Uint8Array; ensure authorization rules allow the salon owner to upload an image for the salon they just created.

Perform a complete backend reset by deleting the existing Motoko backend implementation and replacing it entirely with the user-provided `backend/main.mo` source code, treating it as the official V1.0 backend.
